messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] comics
messages.msgSnippet: No. Thanks for the heads up. I get stuck in a rut and forget to check out other stuff....of course I hate falling in love with a new one since I already spend
messages.messageBody:
No.
Thanks for the heads up.
I get stuck in a rut and forget to check out other stuff....of course I
hate falling in love with a new one since I already spend way too much
on each visit to the Comic Book Store.
Julie

Ren Allen wrote:

>
> "Now I perfer my comics to be darker and with more
> complex charecters like John Constaintine, Swamp Thing, Wolverine or
> The Sandman."
>
> Have you read any of the David Mack comics? He is SO artful and
> creative, plus there's a darker tone to the characters and story
> line.
> He uses collage, photos, drawings etc...to create the comics, very
> different from the usual format. His latest series "The Alchemist"
> is available in comic stores now. Past collections are still
> available but more expensive of course.
> I'm totally hooked!
>
> Ren
>

messages.subject: comics
messages.msgSnippet: Now I perfer my comics to be darker and with more complex charecters like John Constaintine, Swamp Thing, Wolverine or The Sandman. Have you read any of the
messages.messageBody:
"Now I perfer my comics to be darker and with more
complex charecters like John Constaintine, Swamp Thing, Wolverine or
The Sandman."

Have you read any of the David Mack comics? He is SO artful and
creative, plus there's a darker tone to the characters and story
line.
He uses collage, photos, drawings etc...to create the comics, very
different from the usual format. His latest series "The Alchemist"
is available in comic stores now. Past collections are still
available but more expensive of course.
I'm totally hooked!

Ren
